title: Gitlab.com is vulnerable to reverse tabnabbing via AsciiDoc links. (#3)

profile.name: GitLab
profile.about: A single application for the entire software development lifecycle.

vulnerability_information: Dear GitLab bug bounty team, # Summary --- Gitlab.com is vulnerable to reverse tabnabbing in AsciiDoc files. # Why does this vulnerability exist? --- In AsciiDoc the following `http://example.com[Reverse Tabnabbing^]` is equivalent to `Reverse Tabnabbing`. # How can this exploited? --- Same scenario as https://hackerone.com/reports/211065. ;) Best regards, Ed
vulnerability_information_html:
Dear GitLab bug bounty team,

Summary

Gitlab.com is vulnerable to reverse tabnabbing in AsciiDoc files.

Why does this vulnerability exist?

In AsciiDoc the following http://example.com[Reverse Tabnabbing^] is equivalent to <a href="http://example.com" target="_blank">Reverse Tabnabbing</a>.

How can this exploited?

Same scenario as https://hackerone.com/reports/211065. ;)

Best regards,
Ed

activities.message: I have opened an issue and submitted a patch to Asciidoctor: Issue: https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor/issues/2071 PR: https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor/pull/2072 ~~~diff @@ -1031,7 +1031,7 @@ -1031,7 +1031,7 @@ def inline_anchor node end attrs << %( title="#{node.attr 'title'}") if node.attr? 'title', nil, false attrs << %( target="#{node.attr 'window'}") if node.attr? 'window', nil, false - %(#{node.text}) + %(#{node.text}) when :bibref %([#{target}]) else ~~~
activities.markdown_message:
I have opened an issue and submitted a patch to Asciidoctor:

Issue: https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor/issues/2071
PR: https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor/pull/2072

@@ -1031,7 +1031,7 @@ -1031,7 +1031,7 @@ def inline_anchor node
        end
        attrs << %( title="#{node.attr 'title'}") if node.attr? 'title', nil, false
        attrs << %( target="#{node.attr 'window'}") if node.attr? 'window', nil, false
-       %(<a href="#{target}"#{attrs.join}>#{node.text}</a>)
+       %(<a href="#{target}"#{attrs.join} rel="noopener noreferrer">#{node.text}</a>)
      when :bibref
        %(<a id="#{target}"></a>[#{target}])
      else

activities.message:
Hi again @edio!

Thanks for the report. I've verified the vulnerability and opened a confidential issue to discuss a patch: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/29413

Once we've patched the vulnerability the confidential flag will be removed from that issue, I'll update you here, and credit you in the release post and our vulnerability acknowledgements page.

Btw, this will likely also be true of other markup languages such as RDoc, Textile, etc. We'll be patching those as well.

Btw, this will likely also be true of other markup languages such as RDoc, Textile, etc. We'll be patching those as well.

activities.message:
Hi @briann,

> Btw, this will likely also be true of other markup languages such as RDoc, Textile, etc. We'll be patching those as well.

I had a quick look to see whether I could spot any issues and here are my results:

| Language  | Built in target="_blank" feature? | Am I able to inject target="_blank"? |
|-----------|-----------------------------------|--------------------------------------|
| RDoc      | NO                                | NO                                   |
| Textile   | NO                                | NO                                   |
| Creole    | NO                                | NO                                   |
| MediaWiki | NO                                | NO                                   |

Can you name any others?

Best regards,
Ed

activities.message:
Hi @briann,

I have some good news, it appears as though the developers behind Asciidoctor are interested in solving this issue: https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor/issues/2071#issuecomment-286683303

If you need any help patching this issue please let me know.

Best regards,
Ed

activities.message:
Hi @edio,

That's good news. We're still working on a patch for our next security release in any case, as we've found at least one other vulnerable location.

activities.message: I'm sorry to say this security release has been delayed _one more_ day. I promise it will be ready tomorrow, however. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: I'm sorry to say this security release has been delayed one more day. I promise it will be ready tomorrow, however. Thanks!

activities.message: I should have known better than to promise a release date. Unfortunately due to some changes in our infrastructure the security release has been delayed again. Because we don't publish security releases on weekends we won't be able to get this one out until at least Monday. Sorry for the confusion.

activities.message:
Hi @edio,

A patch for this vulnerability has been included in today's security release: https://about.gitlab.com/2017/05/08/gitlab-9-dot-1-dot-3-security-release/

Vulnerability acknowledgements will be updated soon. Thanks again!
